intro: Aldama anchusifolia var. anchusifolia, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers range in color from white to violet. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and botanical collections.
